intro: Chromatotriccum eumelinum, commonly known as the red-stemmed starwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems that often display a reddish hue, especially when mature. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a slightly hairy texture. It is typically found in moist, calcareous soils in temperate regions.
